FuncDef:
The transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command can enable the filtering function and set the filtering interval.
The undo transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command can disable the filtering function.
By default, the filtering function is disabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the interval for filtering alarms when the alarm is delayed.
The value is an integer that ranges from 20-10000 to milliseconds. The default value is 50 ms.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
If an interface is connected to a transmission device and the network is unstable, a large number of burr alarms are generated when the interface frequently alternates between up and down. If you want to ignore these alarms within a certain period, run the transmission-alarm holdoff-timer command to set an interval for filtering transmission alarms. After this command is run, the interface delays going up/down accordingly.
Prerequisites
Transmission alarm customization has been enabled on an interface.
Precautions
The value of the holdoff-time parameter varies with the flapping frequency of interfaces.
